definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: In other places it seems he enjoyed the slight tremble and wander of his hand.
sentences.chinese: 而在其他地方，他似乎挺满意手上轻微的颤抖和晃动。

sentences.english: The mahjong tiles blurred before her eyes. Her heart ached unbearably.
sentences.chinese: 牌在她的眼前晃动起来，她的心痛得厉害。

sentences.english: The sloshing of my new waterproof boots was unnerving .
sentences.chinese: 在晃动我国新型防水靴是紧张。

sentences.english: She yanks her head up and down, right and left.
sentences.chinese: 她前后左右的晃动她的头。

sentences.english: It is a legend would be a landslide tsunami wave tail.
sentences.chinese: 传奇它一晃动尾巴就会山崩海啸。

sentences.english: Analytic method about liquid sloshing for liquid-filled space vehicle;
sentences.chinese: 用等效力学模型法研究了多腔体充液晃动问题。

sentences.english: The barman's face stopped in mid-wobble.
sentences.chinese: 酒吧男侍的脸停止了晃动。

sentences.english: The barman's face stopped in mid-wobble.
sentences.chinese: 酒吧男侍的脸停止了晃动。

sentences.english: Per the Zetas, the wobble is to blame, no question.
sentences.chinese: 齐塔人说，毫无疑问，地毬晃动应该为此承担责任。

sentences.english: And don't shake like a limp fish.
sentences.chinese: 不要像一条酸软的鱼在晃动。

sentences.english: The effect of lubricant on double-revolution shaking have also been studied through experiments.
sentences.chinese: 还研究了润滑油种类对双周晃动的影响。

sentences.english: Flashlights shot streaks of gleam up and down at the walls.
sentences.chinese: 手电筒射出一道道光束，在墙上晃动。

sentences.english: The wall that was shaking is directly above the basement door.
sentences.chinese: 地下室的门正上方的那堵墙又在晃动着。

sentences.english: Raise your arms, jump up, sit down, turn around, and shake your body.
sentences.chinese: 举起胳膊，跳起来，坐下，转圈，晃动身体。

sentences.english: They are shaking as though they are intheir own tiny earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 他们晃动起来的感觉就像是在轻微地震一般。

sentences.english: The sound of the swinging churn rocked Mrs. Thompson first into a gentle doze.
sentences.chinese: 搅乳器晃动的声音首先使得汤普生太太微微打盹。

definition: to sway/to swing/to move back and forth/to oscillate
to rotate (about an axis)/to revolve/to turn/to move in a circle/to gyrate
to shake/to fling one's arm/to lash/to swing
to flip over/to turn (a page)/to scroll (an electronic document)/to stir (food in a pot etc)/to move things about/to rummage
to roll/to turn over/to invert/to flip
